data.description: Title:National Security Solutions (NSS) - Software Developer InternProject OverviewKBR is seeking a SOFTWARE DEVELOPER INTERN to support our Autonomy Modeling and Simulation Team for KBR’s Air Force Programs Business Unit.The purpose of this project is to support an effort seeking to transform the Government Autonomy and Modeling simulation Environment (GAME) simulation software into a more intuitive and accessible tool for users. Demand for the use of the KBR’s autonomy modeling and simulation environment is increasing with current and potential stakeholders with demand signals emerging from additional internal USAF users as well as international partners such as the Netherlands and Royal Australian Air Force. The project stands to benefit current and potential customers with lower long-term maintenance and redesign costs, thus increasing their return on investment. Improving the usability of the GAME simulation software stands to competitively differentiate the software, thus potentially enhancing market competitiveness, contract conversion rates, and client retention.Key ResponsibilitiesAssist in developing software front-end user interface.Help streamlining software installation and configuration requirements.Aid in the development and documentation of software baseline configurations.Facilitate the creation of user training materials.Learning Outcomes & ImpactInterns can expect to gain real-world experience in the development of software for defense industry clients.Minimum QualificationsEducation: High School Diploma or Equivalent GED.Must be at least 18 years of agePursuing a bachelor’s level degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Overall GPA of 3.0 or greater.Knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Office, JavaScript, C, Python, Software Design, and Web Development.Good communication skills (verbal and written).Good interpersonal skills.Ability and desire to manage to take ownership of tasks and deliver them to project on-time.Ability to work with supervision and cross-functional teams with different technical backgrounds.Possess high problem-solving and analytical skills, capability to solve problems with technical understanding, and aptitude to design intuitive solutions for technical and non-technical stakeholders.Preferred QualificationsSome entry level experience and passion in software development and design are preferred.Familiarity with aerospace testing and evaluation is a plus.Acquired at a minimum junior or higher academic standing by start of internship.Familiarity with simulation development and design is a benefit.Belong, Connect and Grow at KBRAt KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
requirements: Help streamlining software installation and configuration requirements.
Must be at least 18 years of age
Pursuing a bachelor’s level degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
responsibilities: Assist in developing software front-end user interface.
Aid in the development and documentation of software baseline configurations.
Knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Office, JavaScript, C, Python, Software Design, and Web Development.
Some entry level experience and passion in software development and design are preferred.
Familiarity with simulation development and design is a benefit.

We Are a Team of Teams – We have a will to succeed, but we value the achievements of our team of teams over individual accomplishments. Our collective focus makes us a better, stronger, more effective company.
